channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Scotland's hottest DJ is 72-year-old Tony Morris
item.description: Tony Morris, a 72-year-old former bookkeeper and taxi driver, is taking over Glasgow's clubs with his dance music.
item.content:encoded: Tony Morris, a 72-year-old former bookkeeper and taxi driver, is taking over Glasgow's clubs with his dance music.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The DNC didn't let a Palestinian American speak. The uncommitted movement took note
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Abbas Alawieh, an uncommitted delegate from Michigan, about the movement's next steps after the DNC did not allow a Palestinian American speaker on the main stage
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Abbas Alawieh, an uncommitted delegate from Michigan, about the movement's next steps after the DNC did not allow a Palestinian American speaker on the main stage
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Saturday Sports: MLB's regular season enters its final month
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks to Howard Bryant, of Meadowlark Media, about the final month of Major League Baseball's regular season, including some exciting pennant races.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon talks to Howard Bryant, of Meadowlark Media, about the final month of Major League Baseball's regular season, including some exciting pennant races.

item.title: 6 takeaways from the DNC, and what it means for both parties going forward
item.description: It might have been all that Democrats hoped for and more, but how might the DNC set up candidates — in both parties — for the last leg before the election?
item.content:encoded: It might have been all that Democrats hoped for and more, but how might the DNC set up candidates — in both parties — for the last leg before the election?
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: The Navajo Nation is raising concerns about mining near the Grand Canyon
item.description: The re-opening of a uranium mine near the Grand Canyon has the Navajo Nation, and now Arizona's attorney general, questioning its safety.
item.content:encoded: The re-opening of a uranium mine near the Grand Canyon has the Navajo Nation, and now Arizona's attorney general, questioning its safety.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Heinsius

item.title: 19-year-old first-time delegate from California shares his experience at the DNC
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to Christian Figueroa who, at 19, became a first-time delegate from California at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to Christian Figueroa who, at 19, became a first-time delegate from California at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Georgia delegate on what it'll take for the Democratic Party to win the swing state
item.description: Georgia Congresswoman Nikema Williams talks to NPR's Scott Simon about the significance of the swing state and what, she thinks, it will take to keep Georgia "blue" in 2024.
item.content:encoded: Georgia Congresswoman Nikema Williams talks to NPR's Scott Simon about the significance of the swing state and what, she thinks, it will take to keep Georgia "blue" in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Benk

item.title: Taliban codifies law dictating how men and women appear in public
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban codified a long set of rules governing morality, including compulsory beards for men and facial covering for women.
item.content:encoded: Afghanistan's Taliban codified a long set of rules governing morality, including compulsory beards for men and facial covering for women.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Week in politics: DNC in Chicago, RFK Jr. withdraws campaign
item.description: We review the eventful week in politics — the Democratic National Convention, the Trump campaign's counterprogramming, and RFK Jr. suspending his campaign.
item.content:encoded: We review the eventful week in politics — the Democratic National Convention, the Trump campaign's counterprogramming, and RFK Jr. suspending his campaign.
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Minnesota Lt. Gov. Peggy Flanagan could be nation’s first Indigenous woman to serve as governor
item.description: Flanagan, a former state lawmaker and children’s advocate, would ascend to the office if Vice President Kamala Harris and Gov. Tim Walz win in November.
item.content:encoded:
Flanagan, a former state lawmaker and children’s advocate, would ascend to the office if Vice President Kamala Harris and Gov. Tim Walz win in November.

(Image credit: Erica Dischino)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson
